body: @zhaoyuguang Is this plugin too complex and conflict with other plugins? If so, let's discuss how to do it first. I noticed this PR is still not finished.

> @zhaoyuguang Is this plugin too complex and conflict with other plugins? If so, let's discuss how to do it first. I noticed this PR is still not finished.

In my opinion, there has been no impact so far, webflux enhances reactor-netty httpserver, gateway enhances reactor-netty httpclient, but I think it's best to separate reactor-netty, webflux, and gateway. Let users choose the supported version based on our testcase pass rate. Is it better?

>  I think it's best to separate reactor-netty, webflux, and gateway. 

If you can do this, I think it is a good idea. If you could separate them, I would suggest you submit a PR to separate reactor-netty and webflux first, After it is landed, we work on gateway agian.

cc @ascrutae I think you should watch this.

> > I think it's best to separate reactor-netty, webflux, and gateway.
> 
> If you can do this, I think it is a good idea. If you could separate them, I would suggest you submit a PR to separate reactor-netty and webflux first, After it is landed, we work on gateway agian.
> 
> cc @ascrutae I think you should watch this.

I also want to try it, but there are some coupling things, I donâ€™t know if I can do it perfectly.

You could try, I just bring Xin in the loop, he needs to review after you done.
 
Try not to make pr too big, that is helpful.

> You could try, I just bring Xin in the loop, he needs to review after you done.
> 
> Try not to make pr too big, that is helpful.

ok
Ref: https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/2517

We don't set this rule. If you want to add a new rule, please explain why.
Right now, we are very flexible in most coding styling things, as long as it doesn't affect the performance and readable, at least I am good for that.

@wu-sheng @IanCao Let me fix it, now I have revived the problem.

> What do you mean a large start? I am not following.

When using Mysql, serviceRelationServerCalls is sorted by entity_id as a result of group by.
So  entity_id sorted like 0xxxx 1xxxx 2xxx ...9xxx.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/866459/57271985-1df4e380-70c4-11e9-8a2a-7022746de9fa.png)

Follow [How-to-build](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/guides/How-to-build.md) :
```
Prepare git, JDK8 and maven3
git clone https://github.com/apache/skywalking.git
cd skywalking/
git submodule init
git submodule update
Run ./mvnw clean package -DskipTests
```
4. Adding Google guava dependency to apm-collector-remote/collector-remote-grpc-provider/pom.xml files
```
<dependency>
   <groupId>com.google.guava</groupId>
   <artifactId>guava</artifactId>
   <version>24.0-jre</version>
</dependency>
```
But I can't find the `apm-collector-remote/collector-remote-grpc-provider` folder in the project.

When I run `./mvnw validate`, some errors occur:
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project apm-agent-core: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.skywalking:apm-agent-core:jar:6.2.0-SNAPSHOT: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.apache.skywalking:apm-network:jar:6.2.0-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.skywalking:apm-util:jar:6.2.0-SNAPSHOT, org.apache.skywalking:apm-datacarrier:jar:6.2.0-SNAPSHOT: Failure to find org.apache.skywalking:apm-network:jar:6.2.0-SNAPSHOT in https://repository.apache.org/snapshots was cached in the local repository, resolution will not be reattempted until the update interval of apache.snapshots has elapsed or updates are forced -> [Help 1]
```

How can we solve this problem? @wu-sheng

> ./mvnw package

This includes style check. Or import the style file into IDE.
I don't know anything about eclipse, I am an IntelliJ Fun :P
Then? Why sort affect the result?

If your concern is `componentId`, you could follow #2534 . Component id is going to be removed in the future. `source + dest` will be the entity id only.

The number of componentId represents nothing, it is just based on the contribution sequence. So logic should not base on that.
You need to figure out nginx setting by yourself.
Yes, please send a pull request to fix it.

if nginx config rigth, and it support http2, this error log whill disappear? that is to say my nginx current  config is error,Is that so?

I don't know whether this is nginx error or not. You should set up env step by step.
1. Local run
1. Remote OAP server
1. Cluster mode OAP server with load balance
1. Add nginx.
When I execute the `mvn compile -Dmaven.test.skip=true` command, it fails, but when it is replaced with `mvn package -Dmaven.test.skip=true`, it works
Compile means compiling source codes, that is all. Package means generating the dist tar. These are maven definitions, in all Java projects.
yes ï¼Œi copied it from the Internet without looking at it.
hello , @wu-sheng , how could i config the check style, it just tells me the reason for the error is checkstyle.

If you run `mvn package` locally, it shows what is the error. Import `codeStyle.xml` to your IDE.
CI has log size limit, could show that.

I need to remind you, you should not change the codes, and submit pull request, only based on your code style. SkyWalking is contributed by 120+ contributors, from dozens of companies, all over the world. I am so sure, each one has a different coding style.

If there is a bug and less check invocation, the improvement of PR is good. If just code style, I think we can't accept it, and should not. Because there is no rule we can say which kind of codes is better in worldwide.
I am going to close this pull request, please consider what I said above. Too many coding style changes in this pull request.

> I need to remind you, you should change the codes based on your code style. SkyWalking is contributed by 120+ contributors, from dozens of companies, all over the world. I am so sure, each one has a different coding style.
> 
> If there is a bug and less check invocation, the improvement of PR is good. If just code style, I think we can't accept it, and should not. Because there is no rule we can say which kind of codes is better in worldwide.


en, thanks for your reminder. this patch is not the code style at all.

> en, thanks for your reminder. this patch is not the code style at all.

I commented why I think it is a coding style thing.
RocketBot has provided customize feature, this is not required.
ok

> What does port 12800 do? Can agent connect directly to port 12800?

Why connect 12800? In 6.x, we connect gRPC port directly. rest is for UI.

> If not, in cluster mode, the agent directly connected to port 11800 needs to set up each collector, which is unfriendly to adding new collectors.

You have a lot of load balance tools, SkyWalking don't want to build it, and you don't need us to do so.
Deploy Envoy, Nginx or any load balance which supports HTTP2/gRPC.
Application toolkit document should update, and add an [integration test case](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases) for this?
GRPC port 11800 12800 is http2 port?
gRPC is HTTP2, rest is HTTP1.
ok,thanks.
6.1.0 has the same problem !!!

> Application toolkit document should update, and add an [integration test case](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases) for this?

ok

> @zhaoyuguang I see. Then do we need new case? Or just do code review?

Here is the compatibility of the transformation program, first of all, there is a problem, the old test cases have no cluster use cases, I first add cluster use cases on the old test cases, and then test, whether it is compatible.

I am happy to help to provide this feature. But I need some help.
I look up the source code about monitoring Hotspot and want to take those code as a reference.
However, I didn't find any plugin named like 'jvm-plugin' or 'hotspot-plugin'.
Where can I find the code about monitoring the JVM?

> Where can I find the code about monitoring the JVM?

What are these? Could you give me some examples?

Now we collect the GC and JVM heap information showed in the dashboard. I want to know where the code about collecting that information is.
I know that it was read from the GC log, is that right?
English only.

`org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.jvm.JVMService` collects the JVM/GC info. 

Pay attention to CPU/Memory/GC providers, they are JVM vendors related. If you try to build the test cases on those, you will see we may not support some JVM vendor, yet. But it is easy to extend.

If you want this, query the data based on graphql, and save the data.

Then you could build the compare.

OSS project should build the core and let others to do extension. I think your idea fits to build an ecosystem project, rather than asking the SkyWalking to do.

I think that will be more interesting, and you could drive the features freely.

I have a issue, in scenario two:
1. have a API "/test_forward"
2.API "/test_forward" mapping method will forward to the URL "/error_proto"

I can not get tracing data. @ascrutae  @wu-sheng 

debug agent workflow, I find that activeSpanStack is not empty in TracingContext, becuase  step6 direct return, then stackDepth = 1  in step7 stopSpan, :
1: TomcatInvokeInterceptor(tomcat plugin) > before method
-----2: AbstractMethodInterceptor(spring plugin) > before method
----------3: ForwardInterceptor(tomcat) > before(set forward flag)
---------------4: AbstractMethodInterceptor > before method(because forward flag then return )
---------------5: AbstractMethodInterceptor > after method(because forward flag then return )
-----6: AbstractMethodInterceptor > after method(because forward flag then return )
7: TomcatInvokeInterceptor(tomcat plugin) > after method
Please submit this to new issue if you could provide demo codes to reproduce the issue.

> DEBUG 2019-05-09 09:17:48:103 DubboServerHandler-10.42.188.146:20883-thread-62 TraceSegmentServiceClient : One trace segment has been abandoned, cause by buffer is full.

This is not a failure. This is a debug log, showing you, backend performance may be not enough to support. So, agent abandons the trace, to avoid to crash your application. This is the key fail-safe mechanism in the agent.

> ERROR 2019-05-09 09:17:48:123 DubboServerHandler-10.42.188.146:20883-thread-62 InstMethodsInterWithOverrideArgs : class[class com.rabbitmq.client.impl.ChannelN] after method[basicPublish] intercept failure
java.lang.IllegalStateException: No active span.

This related to your rabbitmq plugin, maybe not compatible. You need to debug the plugin and find out why. Or provide demo codes to reproduce the error. THe demo codes should be easy for us to run at local.
